summary: This document is an email chain from January 8, 2021, between law enforcement officials discussing outstanding investigative items for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It includes follow-ups on FBI 302 reports, interview notes, video file processing, and arranging an interview with a key individual.

persons.name: Sulec
persons.context: Copied on the email chain discussing follow-ups on Maxwell case items.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation, with outstanding items being tracked for her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to searches of his devices that identified highly confidential items.

connections.description: Maxwell's case involves evidence from searches of Epstein's devices, indicating their connection in the investigation.

events.title: Status Update on Maxwell Case Items
events.description: An email was sent providing updates on outstanding investigative items for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including 302 reports, interview notes, video processing, and contact with a key individual.

events.title: Follow-up on Outstanding Maxwell Items
events.description: A follow-up email was sent requesting updates on FBI 302s, interview notes, video files from CART, and setting up a call with a key individual for the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: Investigators were following up on outstanding items for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including FBI 302 reports and interview notes.
Searches of Jeffrey Epstein's devices had identified highly confidential items (images/videos) relevant to the Maxwell case.
The FBI CART team was processing video files, with completion expected in the new year (2021).
Law enforcement made indirect contact with a key individual who agreed to schedule a call after the new year regarding the Maxwell case going to trial.
